author: wired blogs
text: date: monday, july 17, 2000 1:51 pm from: arden r. chilcoteto: newsfeedback@wired.comsubject: mr. samit & emii am writing in regard to the article, "samit's big music score," (july 13, 2000).this is fascinating stuff! mr. samit is right on the money, as far as i can tell. if he gets "merged" out of a job, i think sony, bmg, and others can make excellent use of him!i'm a classical music lover. angel/emi has a great classical catalog. what are the chances that this music will be come available over the internet like the pop stuff?? i'm convinced that being able to download classical music and thereby not having recordings go "out of print" will be the salvation of recorded classical music!
